brief uncertainty of my waking dream, I would know in what room I
was actually lying, would have reconstructed it round about me in
the darkness, and--fixing my orientation by memory alone, or with the
assistance of a feeble glimmer of light at the foot of which I placed
the curtains and the window--would have reconstructed it complete and
with its furniture, as an architect and an upholsterer might do, working
upon an original, discarded plan of the doors and windows; would have
replaced the mirrors and set the chest-of-drawers on its accustomed
site.

It is a learning by experience, not by ideas or reflection
it is making intelligent use of an expedient

It is admirable, indeed unsurpassable; but it is not intelligent
It is comparable to our sudden withdrawal of our finger from a very hot cinder
it is an instinctive rather than an intelligent efficiency.
It is the critical, scientific way
it is a fish that is learning to breathe dry air
it is also due to new departures among the animals themselves.
It is certainly an old-established creature.
it is a successful animal, well suited for its habitat, and practically cosmopolitan in its distribution.
it is built on exactly the same lines as our modern brains.
It is only a piece of preliminary scaffolding
it is closely comparable to the embryo of a lower vertebrate at a similar stage.
it is very variable, as dwindling structures tend to be
it is a dwindling structure
It is a sort of soap made by the activity of small frog-hoppers while they are still in the wingless larval stage, before they begin to hop
It is conspicuous and yet it is said to be left severely alone by almost all creatures
it is also enacted on the seashore
it is often an expression of nervous excitement, though it sometimes helps to conceal
it is sometimes hard to tell where the jungle ends and the striped tiger begins
It is famous for its extraordinary power of "sailing" round the ship without any apparent strokes of its wings.
It is not so readily captured
It is a world of absolute calm and silence, and there is no scenery on the floor
it is a very long haunt, some 150,000 miles, winding in and out by bay and fiord, estuary and creek
It is often found in the stomachs of marine animals living a long way offshore
it is divisible into zones, each with its characteristic population
It is something like shuffling a pack of cards, but the cards are living
it is the vehicle of a multitude of hereditary items among which there are very likely to be reshufflings or rearrangements
it is a key—a way of looking at things—that fits the facts

It is a region of extreme cold—an eternal winter; of utter darkness—an eternal night—relieved only by the fitful gleams of "phosphorescent" animals; of enormous pressure—2_ tons on the square inch at a depth of 2,500 fathoms; of profound calm, unbroken silence, immense monotony
it is shared equally by all members of the species of the same sex
it is independent of practice or experience, though it may be improved by both
it is suited for pursuing food, for avoiding enemies, for chasing mates
It is a kind of symmetry well suited for sedentary or for drifting life.
it is more curved than the drawing shows
it is not always clear-cut
It is a colony of a thousand or even ten thousand cells, but they are all cells of one kind
It is one of the first animals to suggest the beginning of a body
it is beset with difficulties when the body shows great division of labour, and is very intimately bound into unity
It is, of course, not an ordinary single cell that develops into an earthworm or a butterfly, an eagle, or a man; it is a cell in which a rich inheritance, the fruition of ages, is somehow condensed;
It is commonly found gliding on the mud or weeds in ponds, where it engulfs its microscopic food by means of out-flowing lobes
It is not a power or a principle; it is a process—a process of becoming
It is now an everyday intellectual tool.
It is a luminous interpretation of the world, throwing the light of the past upon the present
it is not a case of an inner stream going one way and an outer stream the other
It is like asking an intelligent insect, living on a single leaf in the midst of a great Brazilian forest, to say what is the shape and size of the forest.
It is one of those problems on which speculation is most tempting but positive knowledge is still very incomplete.
It is inconceivably greater in dimensions than the whole solar system
It is, however, composed of the thinnest vapours imaginable
It is not then a comet, for it has no tail.
it is a dead world.
It is too hot for water to settle on its surface
it is a mass of seething vapours whirling round on its axis once in every ten hours.
It is apparently red-hot
It is of nearly the same size as the earth, and it has a good atmosphere
It is found that each substance (in the same conditions of pressure, etc.) gives a constant spectrum of its own
It is beyond our power to reproduce it
It is the greatest instrument ever devised by the brain and hand of man
It is to this wonderful instrument that we owe our knowledge of the composition of the sun and stars
it is in such conditions that substances are resolved into their simplest forms
it is excessively minute in comparison with the Stellar System, the universe of the Stars, which is on a scale far transcending anything the human mind can apprehend
it is one of the greatest triumphs of modern astronomy
it is far greater than all the planets put together.
It is not in the least meant to be of the nature of an Encyclopdia, giving condensed and comprehensive articles with a big full stop at the end of each.
It is actually composed of many smaller regions that might be the size of the letters on this page.
It is organized as a repeating hierarchy.
It is apparently sufficient to store all the things you can learn in a lifetime.
It is just electrical activity firing in patterns.
It is not an image anymore.
It is not a computer at all.
It is as automatic as breathing
It is constantly predicting what you will see, hear, and feel, mostly in ways you are unconscious of.
It is almost like another sense.
It is a remarkably efficient way to store information about the world and its structure and very different from how computers work.
It is a thing not uncommonly happening to the whale-boats in those swarming seas.
It is not to be much marvelled at
It is a sight that hardly anyone can behold without some sort of unwonted emotion
It is the one; aye, man, It is unsmoothable
It is but the first salutation to the possibilities of the immense Remote, the Wild, the Watery, the Unshored.
It is an inference from certain canonic teachings
It is by far the most complicated part
It is in all material factories.
It is sweet as early grass butter in April.
It is an argument for the pit
It is a place also for profound mathematical meditation
It is an ineffably oozy, stringy affair
It is plums of rubies, in pictures of citron
It is a most refreshing, convivial, beautiful object to behold
It is largely used in perfumery, in pastiles, precious candles, hair-powders, and pomatum
It is of a hue between yellow and ash colour
It is all the same
It is connected with an occupied ship or boat, by any medium at all controllable by the occupant or occupants
It is this which gives that singular darting, leaping motion to the monster when furiously swimming
It is hidden in the snowy sparkling mist enveloping it
It is for the conveyance of air
It is reasonable and true
It is furnished with a small rope called a warp, of considerable length, by which it can be hauled back to the hand after darting
It is not necessary, hints the Bishop
It is often mistaken for it
It is hidden away behind its vast outworks, like the innermost citadel within the amplified fortifications of Quebec
It is impossible to square
It is so exceedingly small, as to be incapable of protrusion
It is an added grandeur
It is both!
It is lodged a little behind the eye
It is the captain's orders
It is still colossal
It is all over obliquely crossed and re-crossed with numberless straight marks in thick array, something like those in the finest Italian line engravings.
It is transparent, as I said before; and being laid upon the printed page, I have sometimes pleased myself with fancying it exerted a magnifying influence.
It is almost as flexible and soft as satin
It is only an opinion
It is all the time being hoisted higher and higher aloft till its upper end grazes the main-top
It is a doubling of the chances
It is stronger, and far more soft and elastic
It is also a fiend to its own off-spring
It is a quiet noon-scene among the isles of the Pacific
It is also very curiously displayed in the side fin, the bones of which almost exactly answer to the bones of the human hand, minus only the thumb.
It is one of the more curious things about this Leviathan, that his skeleton gives very little idea of his general shape.
It is a thing eternally impossible for mortal man to hoist him bodily into the air, so as to preserve all his mighty swells and undulations.
It is Guido's picture of Perseus rescuing Andromeda from the sea-monster or whale.
It is so passing wonderful!
It is used for catching turns with the whale line.
It is at once the most meaning symbol of spiritual things, nay, the very veil of the Christian's Deity; and yet should be as It is, the intensifying agent in things the most appalling to mankind.
It is a mere envelope, or additional skin encasing you
It is not very readily discernible.
It is the only one that can possibly succeed, for it alone is practicable
It is just the same with the other parts above mentioned.
It is a ponderous task.
It is of excellent quality, though mostly confined to scientific description
It is some systematized exhibition of the whale in his broad genera.
It is not down in any map; true places never are.
It is a lesson to us all
It is a two-stranded lesson; a lesson to us all as sinful men, and a lesson to me as a pilot of the living God
It is the image of the ungraspable phantom of life; and this is the key to it all.
It is low-end and elegant both at the same time; even more interesting, we gave the universe a hand in it and left some things to chance.
It is a long-term project, as long-term as anything here on the Beach.
It is the laughter of particles.
It is the moment of maximum vertigo.
It is a moment of reinvention.
It is just a bit of fun.
It is alive, and It is looking for other K-code to talk to.
It is self-aware in a way that might take years to comprehend.
It is something much more intelligent than any of its predecessors.
It is presented as faint grey fingers knotting and unknotting against spectral light.
It is supposed to build something
It is another vessel
It is the old dilemma
It is just some artefact.
It is not in the actual data.
It is always the same problem.
It is a structure of universes, a thing almost like a snowflake.
It is strange harbours.
It is your actual mystery archaeology.
It is several information flows meeting, but nothing solid.
It is a theoretical snowflake existing in 196,833 dimensional space.
It is a multitude of possible alternatives, none of them quite real, all of them contributing towards the actual reality.
It is simple electronics, binary operation.
It is a very designed-looking complex.
It is like living in a piece of science fiction.
It is an object with more than one hundred thousand different angles.
It is unimaginably huge.
It is the only word for it that fits.
It is God.
It is a huge information repository.
It is like a big stack of hard drives.
It is a fairy tale for the weird, you know?
It is not holy.
It is a strange world.
It is made up of situations that stand in all points.
It is the top-down control we insert to speed and direct a system toward our goals.
It is a universal form that will live in a database
It is a refinement in resolution that makes the system far more useful.
It is about letting it be joined to data from other applications.

It is a collection of fragments that can be re-assembled into meaningful (semantic) informational molecules in thousands of new ways that is not possible to do when it remains in a flat un-annotated primitive document.
It is something that can be comprehended by the web itself since It is not rendered in English but in a general semantic form.
It is going to help us a lot to make sure we go exploring with our eyes wide open
It is a remarkably accurate description of games that can be played with Babelfish and the internet.
It is making a reference to an object that isn't there.
It is dealing with more complicated things.
It is doing more things.
It is interested in more things.
It is a very effective system.
It is perfect because It isn't perfected yet, but maybe it will be soon.
It is such an empty vessel for what you might be able to put into it.
It is qualitative (such as shapes, proximities, etc).
It is also a prediction of the future, from deities, that is spoken through another object or life-form.

It is a generic stateless object-oriented protocol, which may be used for many similar tasks such as name servers, and distributed object-oriented systems, by extending the commands, or "methods", used.
It is like changing the DNA.
It is a paradox--it can't be found, and yet it couldn't be more vivid.
It is made out of passing memory.
It is like a mother re-uniting with her child.
It is like remembering something.
It is what happens when you fall in love with somebody.
It is like trying to see when water turns to steam.
It is all an excellent opportunity to connect with this sense of each situation being like a memory.
It is also the air we breathe and the heart that beats inside us.
It is soft and gentle.
It is clear and sharp.
It is open.
It is something that we already have but usually have not yet discovered.
It is like pushing the doorbell and waiting for someone to answer.
It is designed especially for people who find themselves living in times of darkness.

fields.title: About this Project
fields.content:
What It Asks:

  • What if we could collect all the statements, from all fields of knowledge, that describe what “it” is?
  • What if we could pull them out of their original sources and contexts, and play with them, remix them, in new ways?
  • What new meanings could emerge?
  • What could we do, collaboratively, with such a collection, and with such an approach to our systems and sources of knowledge?

What It Is:

  • It is an initial exploration of these questions, not a final answer.
  • It is a playground and a tool.
  • It is a suggestion that we can remix knowledge, just as we can remix other media.
  • It is an experiment in object-oriented thought, the concept that thoughts are objects that can be appropriated, manipulated, and adapted to the needs of the moment.
  • It is an experimental space for the exploration of quantum semantics, the belief that we can break down large, heavy thought-objects (source texts) into small, discrete, lightweight thought-objects (statements), and that the powerful semantic energies unleashed by this process can be channeled into new meanings.
  • It is a practice of radical recombinance, the collection and remixing of radicals (i.e. "roots") into new thought-objects, guided by intuition, intent, and improvisation (as opposed to systematic rationality).
  • It is a suggestion of a new process and a playground for a new method (as opposed to a fixed, final product).
  • It is just an initial step.

Ultimately, "What It Is" depends on how you want to use it, what you imagine it could be.
We invite you to help us discover that, by:

  • Playing with the site, and creating your own collection of statements.
  • Adding a statement or source text.
  • Downloading the statements for your own use.
  • Sending suggestions, questions, or other feedback to "adam" AT "therealadamgood.com"
  • Joining us on Facebook

"What It Is" was conceived by Adam Good, and built by Chris Davis, Tim Cripps, James Stevenson, and Chuck Harmston.

It Is based an open-source cycle of use and re-use. These statements are their own agents now. This system is a seed for more systems. Go crazy. Just let us know what cool stuff you're doing with them.


What It Is by What It Is is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.

fields.title: Discover What "It" Is
fields.content:
These statements describe what “it” is. They are taken from all fields of knowledge. By collecting these statements, we discover new possibilities for what “it” could be.

  • Find what it is ›
  • Learn more about the project ›

fields.title: Participate
fields.content:
“What It Is” is an open-source work in progress, an evolving tool.
We’d like you to use it, and to help us expand it.

We invite you to download the statements collected here for your own use.
Download all statements as a CSV file

We’d also appreciate any suggestions you have about how we can expand this project, ways that you’d like to help, or feedback on how you are using the statements.

Please email comments, suggestions, or inquiries to "adam" AT "therealadamgood.com."

You can also add a statement or source to the database, while you’re here.
Or join us on Facebook.

Thanks for playing.
The "What It Is" Team

fields.title: Synopsis for Transmediale Submission
fields.content:
Comment, if you'd like, below.

“What It Is” is a tool for collecting statements from all fields of knowledge, that describe what “it” is, and for remixing them into new knowledge. All disciplines use the phrase “it is” to describe and construct the concepts and objects within their domains. This project asks the question: what if we took all those descriptions, freed them from their original contexts, collected them in one database, and allowed people to reuse them for their own purposes? We believe that doing this will create new possibilities for what “it” could be, and will allow new realities to emerge.

“What It Is” proposes a new model for interacting with, and creating, knowledge, a model based on breaking down all texts into small, lightweight objects (i.e., statements) that can be explored and reused without the constraints of academic disciplines. This model aims to make knowledge more flexible, adaptive, recombinant, improvisatory, and collaborative. Accordingly, we leverage the open web technologies (HTML 5, Django) and practices that are essential to creating this transformation.

We see “What It Is” as the first step towards a vast, open-source “Database of Descriptions” that breaks down ALL knowledge into small, discrete components for perpetual reuse. We invite the artistic, developer, and scientific communities to help us build this system and create applications that expand its capabilities. We invite you to help us discover what “it” is and, more importantly, to create what “it” could be.

Comments???
